meanings.definition: The quality or state of being firm.
meanings.sent1: She admired the firmness of the ground beneath her feet.
meanings.sent2: The mattress provided excellent firmness for his back.
meanings.sent3: The jello surprised everyone with its unexpected firmness.
meanings.sent4: His handshake conveyed a sense of firmness and determination.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor needed the perfect firmness in the clay to create his masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The degree of resistance to pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: The firmness of the rope prevented it from breaking under the weight.
meanings.sent2: The firmness of the wall withstood the strong winds of the storm.
meanings.sent3: The firmness of the rubber band made it difficult to stretch.
meanings.sent4: Her decision was met with firmness and conviction.
meanings.sent5: The firmness of the lock kept the door securely closed.

meanings.definition: The quality of being steady or unwavering.
meanings.sent1: His firmness in his beliefs never wavered despite opposition.
meanings.sent2: The captain's firmness in his orders kept the crew disciplined.
meanings.sent3: The firmness of her resolve surprised even her closest friends.
meanings.sent4: The firmness of the foundation ensured the building's stability.
meanings.sent5: The firmness of her voice conveyed her unwavering determination.
